revised_title: Ocular Vergence Dynamics Under Natural Conditions
tldr: This study investigates ocular vergence responses under natural conditions, where multiple depth cues are present, and compares them to previous experiments that focused on isolated motion-in-depth cues. The research finds that ocular vergence under natural conditions has shorter delays and better dynamics than expected from previous experiments, and voluntary movements of the upper torso provide the most accurate vergence tracking.
